title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Public Policy Advocates

content.rendered:
What is a Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocate?

A Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocate is someone who is responsible for the communication of an organization’s views.

Where does a Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocate work?

  • Government agencies
  • Non-profit organizations

How much does a Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocate make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocate is $31,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocates?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Political science majors
  • Legal studies majors
  • Philosophy majors
Search roles on Handshake

Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocate skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocates succeed in their work:

  • Public speaking skills
  • Critical thinking and analytical skills
  • Strong listening skills

What are some common questions about Public Policy and Government Affairs Advocates?

Q: What is public policy?

A: Public policy can be defined broadly as action taken by the government in response to public issues.
